_header: Blessed Denis of Athens chief son
Subjects: prayers, to saints; Denis, saint; Christopher, saint; Blasius, saint; Egidius, saint; George, saint; Giles, saint; Catherine of Alexandria, saint; Martha, saint; Margaret, saint; Christine, saint; Barbara, saint
_description: John Lydgate, ‘Prayers to Ten Saints’ — twelve 8-line stanzas, with two varying refrains, ‘haue…memorye’ and ‘marter and virgyne’

BodLauMis683.First Lines:
Blissed denys of athenys cheef sonnesterre of grece charboncle of
                    that contre…
BodLauMis683.Last Lines:
…for thy sake on vs to haue pyteas thou art verray marter and
                    virgyne
BodLauMis683.Attributed Title:
These holy seyntys folwyng ar preuyleged of our lord ihesu that what man or
                    woman praieth to them rightfully shal haue his bone (f.
                    24v)
BodLauMis683.Editions:
MacCracken,  Henry Noble,
                        ed.  
             John Lydgate: The Minor Poems, Vol. I: Religious Poems.
EETS
         e.s. 107 (1911; repr. 1961): 120-4.

CamJes56.First Lines:
[B]lissid denys of Athenis chief sonneSterre of grece Charbucle of
                    þat contre…
CamJes56.Last Lines:
…ffor thy sake on vs haue piteeAs þu art verray martir
                    and virgyne

CamSidney37.First Lines:
O Blessed denys of athenes chefe soneSterre of grece charbuncle of
                    that contre…
CamSidney37.Last Lines:
…ffor the wiche remembrith in your specialle preyereOn alle
                    tho þat haue þou deuoutely in memory
